At this critical juncture, we must work together to provide #Ukraine with the resources they need to defend democracy.

I am encouraged that the U.S. is sending Abrams battle tanks, made in my home state of #Ohio, to Poland. This will send a critical message to Russia that the United States stands for freedom not only in #Ukraine but throughout all of Europe and the world.
The Russians have captured Europe's single largest nuclear power plant, and have taken the Ukrainian employees captive. Russia continues to irresponsibly use oil, gas, and energy as a weapon of war.

We also heard extensively about the recent progress in increasing oversight and accountability for U.S. economic and military aid to Ukraine. I am hopeful that progress on this important issue will continue.
America‚Äôs aid has greatly improved Ukraine‚Äôs position across the battlefield and has enabled Ukraine‚Äôs recently commenced counteroffensive against Russia‚Äôs invasion.

During our trip, we met with President @ZelenskyyUa who thanked the American people for their support and assistance which has played a vital role in helping Ukraine defend itself against Russia‚Äôs cold-blooded invasion.
Last week, I visited #Ukraine with my colleague, @amyklobuchar. We believed it was important to demonstrate bipartisan support for #Ukraine at such a critical time.
Last night, I spoke on the Senate floor for the 21st consecutive session week to discuss Russia‚Äôs brutal and unprovoked war of aggression on the people of #Ukraine.
